body: $AAPL This is a knee jerk reaction to the BBB probable defeat as well as Covid rising to everyone is taking a shit so yes shits going down BUT words I live by FEAR=MONEY.

$TSLA so tomm is gonna red as fuck across the board. I’m betting a 2% drop.  It’s not going to be pretty. $AAPL and $SPY are gonna drop hard, 7-10 bucks.  Especially after the downgrade. We in big trouble ladies and gents. On the flip side I do see Telsa initially going green for a pump, but a rather fast fade from probably 960 back down to 924 or 927.  It’s a short week, look to heges bringing out all the ammo to push these stocks down.  Still bullish on tesla January 2020.

$AAPL 3 years ago, on Christmas Eve, the market suffered a bloodbath! So for those who say it wont happen or can’t happen, those who say stocks only go higher, well, you are WRONG! Now yes, over the long term the stock will likely rise as long as the fundamentals of the company remain strong but in the short term any stock is vulnerable to massive corrections, even Apple!

body: $SPY bulls tomorrow $AAPL

$AAPL $SPY It looks that Sen. Joe Minchin decided that he must buy stocks cheaper by giving interview on Fox… on Sunday. Hmm, poor guy, he doesn’t get enough money from the oil, pharmaceutical and defense donors. He’s also agains raising taxes for billionaires like Elon that paid 70K tax for two tax years all together (FY 2017 and FY 2018)…

But wait, he cares about the debt and mostly about poor people and the country…

Funny that few years ago when trump passed the 7.5bln tax relief for billionaires he was very quiet and did not talk about growing debt. On the other hand the 1.75bin now it’s a BIG debt problem. Just last week he was very happy to pass the defense bill adding about 23bln to defense spendings.

links.title: How Flu Viruses Can Change
links.description: Influenza (flu) viruses are constantly changing. They can change in two different ways. Antigenic Drift One way flu viruses change is called "antigenic drift." Drift consists of small changes (or mutations) in the genes of influenza viruses that can lead to changes in the surface proteins of the virus, HA (hemagglutinin) and NA (neuraminidase).

source.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
